meanings.definition: The act or process of organizing something according to a system.
meanings.sent1: The systemization of our files made it easier to find important documents.
meanings.sent2: Proper systemization of the inventory helped streamline the warehouse operations.
meanings.sent3: The systemization of my closet was so meticulous that even my socks were color-coded!
meanings.sent4: Her systemization of the project was like putting together a complex puzzle with ease.
meanings.sent5: The systemization of the assembly line made production faster and more efficient.

meanings.definition: The state of being organized according to a system.
meanings.sent1: The systemization of the company's departments improved communication among employees.
meanings.sent2: The systemization of the schedule prevented any overlapping appointments.
meanings.sent3: His systemization of his daily routine was so strict that he even scheduled time for naps!
meanings.sent4: The systemization of the city's traffic flow was like orchestrating a symphony of cars.
meanings.sent5: The systemization of the data made it easier to analyze and draw conclusions.
